enGB: Masters of both mounted combat and arcane marksmanship, these versatile warriors ride into battle atop mounts imbued with magical speed and agility. With a swift gesture, they can enchant their arrows with elemental forces or debilitating effects, turning each shot into a potentially game-changing strike from the saddle.

In stark contrast to their more explosive brethren, Life Sensates have learned to harness the raw power of the elements not to scorch their foes, but to mend the wounds of their allies. These unique kineticists hone their ability to channel forces through rigorous life long studies into primal life energies learning to revive, heal, and protect those around them. By forgoing the volatile aspects of kineticism, Life Sensates achieve a profound mastery over life-affirming elements, making them invaluable assets to any party seeking to weather the harshest of challenges.

This seemingly simple statue swirls with the primal energy of Triceratop heroes of ages past. Using it may bind the spirit of those heroes to your cause. Echoes from the energies whisper the name 'Bismuth'.

This seemingly simple statue swirls with the primal energy of Triceratop heroes of ages past. Using it may bind the spirit of those heroes to your cause. Echoes from the energies whisper the name 'Bismuth'.
Your Triceratops companion grows in power as you level, gaining animal companion ranks that allow it to benefit from feats like Boon Companion.

You gain a Triceratops animal companion. The companion's effective level is your character level minus 4 (minimum 1). This uses the standard animal companion system and works with Boon Companion and other animal companion feats.

A life sensate's base Will save bonus from the kineticist class is equal to 2 + 1/2 their kineticist level, and their base Reflex and Fortitude save bonuses are equal to 1/3 their kineticist level.
A life sensate uses their Intelligence modifier instead of their Constitution modifier to determine their damage with wild talents, the DCs of Constitution-based wild talents, the durations of wild talents with Constitution-based durations, their bonus on concentration checks for wild talents, and any other Constitution-based effects of all their wild talents.
This alters the kinesticist's class skills and base savings throws and the key ability score of wild talents.

At 3rd level, a life sensate gains a +1 bonus on attack rolls and damage rolls with their kinetic blasts. The damage bonus doesn't apply to kinetic blade, kinetic whip, or other infusions that don't apply the damage bonus from elemental overflow.
This bonus increases by 1 at 6th level and every 3 levels thereafter.

A life sensate develops an attunement to life energies emanating from the Positive Energy Plane through extensive studies into the nature of that realm. This understanding allows the sensate to tap into the water-like torrents of life energies flowing into this realm for both offensive and healing purposes. A life sensate can not access other elemental energies.

A growing sensitivity to the life energies that emenate from the Positive Energy Plane empowers the life sensate's healing abilities. The life sensate's Kinetic Healer ability is now empowered as per the Empower metamagic.

At 11th level, when using 'Gather Power' as a move action, a kineticist can reduce the total burn cost of a single infusion by 2 points instead of 1. When using gather power for 1 full round, she can reduce the burn cost of a single infusion by 3 points instead of 2.

Residual energies from the torrents that flow into the life sensate during rest heal burn from the sensate's abilities. The sensate will instantly heal a number of burn points per day equal to the the sensate's Intelligence bonus modifier per rest. The life sensate does not control when these residuals are used. The energies will be used to compensate for burn if any lingering energy exists.

Residual energies from the torrents that flow into the life sensate during rest heal burn from the sensate's abilities. The sensate will instantly heal a number of burn points per day equal to the the sensate's Intelligence bonus modifier per rest. The life sensate does not control when these residuals are used. The energies will be used to compensate for burn if any lingering energy exists.
The life sensate has learned to better control the application of energies, allowing them to select the targets of their healing bursts.
The life sensate has learned to better control the application of energies, allowing them to select the targets of their healing bursts.

Focus, perception, and a keen-eye are the hallmarks of good adventurers. It's amazing what one can do when these attributes are applied to something as simple as cantrips. The keen-eyed adventurer adds their intelligence bonus as damage to attacks with Ray of Frost, Jolt, Ignition, and Acid Splash. Cantrip Specialization is replaced by Cantrip Mastery at archetype level 20.
At 1st level, a life sensate chooses which aspect of the torrents of life energy that flow into this plane that they will develop. They gain Shroud of Water as a bonus wild talent.
At 15th level, a life sensate masters the totality of the torrents of life energy that flow into this plane.

The life sensate may accept 1 burn to focus their energies into a shield that grants all allies within a 25-foot radius limited protection from damage of whichever one of five energy types you select: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. The subject gains resist energy 10 against the energy type chosen, meaning that each time the creature is subjected to such damage (whether from a natural or magical source), that damage is reduced by 10 points before being applied to the creature's hit points. The value of the energy resistance granted increases to 20 points at 7th level and to a maximum of 30 points at 11th level.

Through extensive trial and error with cantrips, the keen-eyed adventurer learns to imbue additional power into their Jolt, Ignition, Ray of Frost and Acid Splash cantrips. When enabled, these cantrips deal 1 extra point of damage per dice rolled and have the ability to ricochet to other targets.
Benefit: Deal 1 extra point of damage per damage dice rolled. 1 to 3 additional targets within 20 feet of the main target may take ricochet damage... depending on how the whims of fate favor you this day.

Tinkering with the casting patterns of your Elemental Vortex has led to some unexpected results. It might be a bit haphazard but there is no denying... it is more powerful. Elemental Vortex will randomly strike out at enemies near the area of effect with elemental bolts of energy for 10d3 damage each turn Elemental Vortex is active. All good adventurers know that inevitably they are at the whims of varying fate, and you may find that the number of affected enemies varies with your luck.

Through continued intensive studies the life sensate has learned to make the most of their healing capabilties. The life sensate's Kinetic Healer ability is now maximized as per the Maximize metamagic.

Through continued intensive studies the life sensate has learned to make the most of their healing capabilties. The life sensate's Healing Burst ability is now maximized as per the Maximize metamagic.

Kinetic Instauration immediately ends any and all of the following adverse conditions affecting the target: ability damage, blinded, confused, dazed, dazzled, diseased, exhausted, fatigued, nauseated, poisoned, sickened, and stunned. Additionally, this ability can target allies as well as the life sensate.

Mass Kinetic Instauration immediately ends any and all of the following adverse conditions affecting the target: ability damage, blinded, confused, dazed, dazzles, diseased, exhausted, fatigued, nauseated, poisoned, sickened, and stunned. This ability targets an area.

A growing sensitivity to the life energies that emenate from the Positive Energy Plane empowers the life sensate's healing abilities. The life sensate's Healing Burst ability is now empowered as per the Empower metamagic.

Through intensive study of elemental forces and precision focus, the keen-eyed adventurer has learned to make their basic cantrips transcend normal elemental resistance. Your Ignition, Ray of Frost, Jolt, and Acid Splash cantrips now ignore elemental resistance and immunity, striking true regardless of the target's natural or magical protections against these energy types.
Charges remaining - Each charge prevents 1 point of burn. Maximum charges based on Intelligence modifier.

These neutral-aligned monks have mastered the art of guiding caravans through treacherous desert routes and mountain passes. Drawing from ancient traditions of balance and survival, Dustwalkers forsake some traditional monastic abilities in favor of practical skills for leading groups through dangerous terrain. They form bonds with animal companions and develop enhanced survival instincts, making them invaluable guides for those seeking safe passage through the world's most perilous regions.
A dustwalker gains Lore (nature) as a class skill.

At 1st level, a dustwalker can make a flurry of blows as a full attack. When making a flurry of blows, the dustwalker can make one additional attack at their highest base attack bonus. This additional attack stacks with the bonus attacks from haste and other similar effects. When using this ability, the dustwalker can make these attacks with any combination of their unarmed strikes and weapons that have the monk special weapon quality. They take no penalty for using multiple weapons when making a flurry of blows, but they do not gain any additional attacks beyond what's already granted by the flurry for doing so. At 11th level, a dustwalker can make an additional attack at their highest base attack bonus whenever they make a flurry of blows.

A dustwalker is proficient with all simple and martial weapons and with light armor, instead of a monk's usual weapon and armor proficiencies. When wearing armor, using a shield, or carrying a medium or heavy load, a dustwalker loses their AC bonus, as well as their fast movement and flurry of blows abilities.
At 1st level a dustwalker gains a horse as a mount. A dustwalker may spend 1 point from their ki pool to grant their mount temporary hit points equal to twice their level for 1 hour per level.
A dustwalker gains a bonus on initiative rolls equal to 1/2 their monk level. At 20th level, a dustwalker's initiative roll is automatically a natural 20.
A dustwalker may select mounted combat feats as bonus feats.

While in desert terrain, a dustwalker gains a +2 bonus on initiative checks and Lore (nature), Perception, and Stealth skill checks. Each time the dustwalker selects an additional favored terrain, the skill bonus and initiative bonus in any one favored terrain (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by +2.

At 3rd level, a dustwalker learns total expertise over desert terrain they have already selected for favored terrain. When dealing with creatures in desert terrain, the dustwalker treats their favored terrain bonus for desert as a favored enemy bonus against those creatures. This bonus overlaps (doesn't stack with) bonuses gained when fighting a favored enemy. The dustwalker gains a +1 insight bonus on saving throws against fire effects.

At 4th level, as a swift action, a dustwalker may spend 1 point from their ki pool to grant any weapon they wield (including their unarmed strike) a +1 enhancement bonus on attack and damage rolls, increasing by +1 per four levels after 4th to a maximum bonus of +5 at 20th level, until the end of their next turn.
A dustwalker gains a +3 bonus on all checks involving Lore (nature). If they have 10 or more ranks in Lore (nature), this bonus increases to +6.
At 5th level, a dustwalker becomes completely immune to poison.

While in abyssal terrain, a dustwalker gains a +2 bonus on initiative checks and Lore (nature), Perception, and Stealth skill checks. Each time the dustwalker selects an additional favored terrain, the skill bonus and initiative bonus in any one favored terrain (including the one just selected, if so desired) increases by +2.

At 8th level, a dustwalker learns total expertise over abyssal terrain. When dealing with creatures in abyssal terrain, the dustwalker treats their favored terrain bonus for the Abyss as a favored enemy bonus against those creatures. This bonus overlaps (doesn't stack with) bonuses gained when fighting a favored enemy.

At 11th level, a dustwalker can make an additional attack at their highest base attack bonus whenever they make a flurry of blows. This stacks with the first attack from this ability and additional attacks from haste and similar effects.
A dustwalker of 13th level or higher can, as a move action, use the Stealth skill to hide in any of their favored terrains, even in combat.

At 9th level, a dustwalker's extensive experience managing pack animals and mounts during long caravan journeys translates into exceptional rapport with beasts. All animal companions within 30 feet of the dustwalker gain a +10 foot enhancement bonus to their movement speed, as they respond naturally to the dustwalker's practiced commands and movements.
This animal companion gains a +10 foot enhancement bonus to movement speed from responding to the dustwalker's practiced handling.
A bard archetype that specializes in using bardic performances to enhance animal companions and pets only, not human party members.
Select a bonus talent to enhance your beast mastery abilities.

Your deep connection with animals and nature grants you unique insights into the primal world. This bond allows you to develop nature-themed abilities as you grow in power.

You gain Lore (Nature) and Athletics as class skills.
You summon a swarm of angry bees that surge toward your enemy, dealing 1d3 points of force damage per two caster levels plus your Charisma bonus. This spell targets a single creature within 30 feet.
You have learned to summon swarms of angry bees to attack your enemies. This cantrip is automatically added to your known spells.

A bard of 9th level or higher can use his performance to inspire greatness in all animal companions and summoned creatures within 30 feet, granting extra fighting capability. A creature inspired with greatness gains 2 bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} (d10s), the commensurate number of {g|Encyclopedia:Temporary_HP}temporary hit points{/g} (apply the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier, if any, to these bonus Hit Dice), a +2 competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, and a +1 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saves{/g}.

This version only affects animal companions and summoned creatures, not party members.

A bard of 15th level or higher can inspire tremendous heroism in all animal companions and summoned creatures within 30 feet. Inspired creatures gain a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} and a +4 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The effect lasts for as long as the targets are able to witness the performance.

This version only affects animal companions and summoned creatures, not party members.

A bard of 12th level or higher can use his performance to create an effect equivalent to a {g|SpellsMassCureSeriousWounds}cure serious wounds, mass{/g}, using the bard's level as the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. In addition, this performance removes the {g|ConditionFatigued}fatigued{/g}, {g|ConditionSickened}sickened{/g}, and {g|ConditionShaken}shaken{/g} condition from all those affected. Using this ability requires 4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} of continuous performance.

This version only affects animal companions and summoned creatures, not party members.

A bard of 12th level or higher can use his performance to create an effect equivalent to a {g|SpellsMassCureSeriousWounds}cure serious wounds, mass{/g}, using the bard's level as the {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. In addition, this performance removes the {g|ConditionFatigued}fatigued{/g}, {g|ConditionSickened}sickened{/g}, and {g|ConditionShaken}shaken{/g} condition from all those affected. Using this ability requires 4 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} of continuous performance.

This version only affects animal companions and summoned creatures, not party members.

Your natural affinity for animals grants powerful protection to your companions. All animal companions and summoned creatures within 30 feet of you gain a bonus on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to your {g|StatCharisma}Charisma{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}.

You have learned to coordinate with your animal companions and summoned creatures as if they were trained warriors. Choose one {g|Encyclopedia:Teamwork}teamwork feat{/g}. You share the effects of this teamwork feat with your animal companion and all creatures you summon within 30 feet of you. This allows your companions to benefit from teamwork tactics even if they don't have the feat themselves.
